Class com.icl.saxon.XRenderer 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----com.icl.saxon.XRenderer
public class XRenderer
extends Object
Class XRenderer
A wrapper class to provide the same services as Renderer, but via an interface that can easily be used from ActiveX clients such as VBScript

XRenderer()

getErrorText()
Get error message.
readBucket(String)
Read the contents of an output bucket
selectBucket(String, String)
Create an output bucket for a particular element type
setGroupRendition(String, String, String, String)
Supply strings to be used for the rendition of a consecutive sequence of instances of a given XML element type.
setInputFile(String)
Process a supplied XML input file.
setItemRendition(String, String, String)
Supply a prefix and suffix to be used for the rendition of a given XML element type.
setNumbering(String, String, boolean)
Establish automatic numbering on an element.
setSorter(String, String, String, String, String)
Establish sorting on the elements within a group.
A group is defined as a number of consecutive elements of the same type, subordinate to the same parent element.

XRenderer 
 public XRenderer()

selectBucket 
 public void selectBucket(String element,
                          String bucketName)
Create an output bucket for a particular element type

Parameters:
element - The selected element type, or a pattern in the form "PARENT/CHILD"
bucketName - A string to identify this output bucket, so that its contents can be retrieved later using readBucket()
readBucket 
 public String readBucket(String bucketName)
Read the contents of an output bucket

Parameters:
bucketName - The name of the bucket to be read. This must be the name of a bucket established earlier using selectBucket()
setItemRendition 
 public void setItemRendition(String element,
                              String before,
                              String after)
Supply a prefix and suffix to be used for the rendition of a given XML element type. The "before" and "after" strings can include textual substitution of attributes or pseudo-attributes. Textual substitution is invoked by including a pattern of the form «ELEMENT/ATTRIBUTE» (between guillemots or angle quotation marks as shown). The special attribute names "#" (element number) and "*" (element content) are recognised.

Parameters:
element - The tag of the specified element; or a pattern of the form "PARENT/CHILD"
before - Text to be output before the contents of the element.
after - Text to be output after the contents of the element.
setGroupRendition 
 public void setGroupRendition(String element,
                               String before,
                               String between,
                               String after)
Supply strings to be used for the rendition of a consecutive sequence of instances of a given XML element type.

Parameters:
element - The tag of the specified element, or a pattern of the form "PARENT/CHILD"
before - Text to be output before the contents of the first (or only) element in a sequence.
between - Text to be output between consecutive instances of the element.
after - Text to be output after the contents of the last (or only) element in a sequence.
setNumbering 
 public void setNumbering(String element,
                          String baseElement,
                          boolean concatenate)
Establish automatic numbering on an element. The numbers may be accessed as a special attribute named "#".

Parameters:
element - The element to be automatically numbered. May be in the form "PARENT/CHILD".
baseElement - The ancestor element that causes numbering to reset to one.
concatenate - True if numbers are to be concatenated with those of the base element
setSorter 
 public void setSorter(String element,
                       String sortkey,
                       String before,
                       String between,
                       String after)
Establish sorting on the elements within a group.
A group is defined as a number of consecutive elements of the same type, subordinate to the same parent element.

Parameters:
element - The tag of the elements to be sorted. May be in the form "PARENT/CHILD".
Restriction:Do not use this for an element that can be nested within itself. The effect of doing so is undefined.
sortkey - The attribute on which the elements will be sorted. This may be an actual XML attribute in the input document, or a pseudo-attribute created using setExtendedAttribute(). It may also be the special value "*" which refers to the character content of the element.
before - A string to be output before the first element in a sorted group of elements
between - A string to be output after each element in the sorted output, other than the last
after - A string to be output after the last element in the sorted group of elements
setInputFile 
 public int setInputFile(String inputFile)
Process a supplied XML input file. This method should be called after all element handlers have been initialised.

Parameters:
inputFile - The XML input filename
Returns:
result code: zero indicates success, non-zero failure
getErrorText 
 public String getErrorText()
Get error message. Returns error message if there has been an error, zero-length string otherwise. Resets the error message, so each message can be read once only.

Returns:
The error message, if any
